post.body: Got Twibble recently. Still getting to grips with it. Seems OK so far.
Someone, somewhere, will come back with a dirty joke as the answer.
Sorry. Should have read more carefully. Fring only has limited twitter stuff. Have you tried Twibble?
I've just got Fring for VoIP. Not had a chance to try it yet, mind. Also depends on WiFi hotspots etc. to avoid paying for data.
In my office those desktop/laptop reactions would be the opposite. Perhaps I need a new job.
Happy bday. All that stuff about ones 30s being better than ones 20s is true so far for me. Hope it proves the same for you.
Mo Gala - something to do with Movember?
Pants off will aid for comparing the nut-posting potential of both phones, I suppose.
The goggles, they do nothing!
Pics or GTFO.
I thought we had them already, but can't find owt on google. Perhaps I was thinking of bog roll - think there's Andrex w aloe.
You'd have a hard time parking that in Sainsbos carpark for the weekend shop.
:D
Switched to Chrome for now. It's nice and fast, tho I miss my adblock. Confirmed it was the flash that was dodgy so uninstalled.
Poss. just coincidence but a flash update from that site seems to have killed FF3 for me.
Was a bit coldplay heavy for individual tracks, but that's what people scrobbled. Found the new artists bit most interesting.
One thing computers are great for: making one's bile rise. Once your zen calm is gone only time will bring it back.
Oh, just saw that you said the same thing yourself later on. Must read all tweets before replying.
Aren't all butt-plugs for putting rings on, in a manner of speaking?
Seems everyone's there, all twittering away. Can haz instant updates kthxbai.
Have heard nothing but bad reviews about the Storm. Did you hear about @stephenfry's testicular Storm incident?
Chicken in a white wine and tarragon sauce, with new spuds and salad. A bit summery, really, but still very nice.
Many happies! Hope you're celebrating tonight not working until superlate again.
Ha! I'll believe that when I see it. Am on their 8mb but getting considerably less.
Enjoyed the smartphone piece v much. Expect my next phone to be either iPhone 3 or G2 in 18 months to 2 yrs time.
Yay! Hitting the big time :)
Was working OK about 10 mins ago.
You could mash that up with http://redo.me.uk/ for even more fun.
Cool. I'm most often in the lounge these days, but there's lots of useful/interesting stuff in the other areas.
That's perhaps better than what I have: the Lazy Scouts song from Lazy Town. Here's the YouTube: http://is.gd/aYva
http://is.gd/ge7
I don't know, what do you call just married spiders?
Is good but needs more Jonadab: http://is.gd/blcA
That's ruff. (Sorry.)
I'm in Monday and Tuesday next week. It's going to be veeeery quiet. Pub lunch time, I think.
What, so he feels her signs rather than sees them?
How about a video of a Dane failing miserably to karate chop through 100 coconuts? http://is.gd/cktV.
The soup sounds good. I prefer recipes vague these days - makes more sense somehow. Also liked chipped bowl = real person. :)
A bit miffed that the first I hear of pownce is when it's closing down. Looks like it was good. Ah well, there you go.
Motivation low today. Been procrastinating so long inertia has set in. Geh.
Some bloke in the Times writes in praise of what is, basically, a ponced-up girdle. Ha! http://is.gd/9JjZ
We Londoners are a bunch of lonely glumsters. http://is.gd/9J3e Doesn't seem so in my little corner of town. Unsurprising overall.
In the mood for some geeky fiction. Perhaps some William Gibson. There must be at least one of his books left that I haven't read yet.
Ho ho! Just seen my twitter grade. Is very lowly. I shall endeavour to keep it so. Ridiculous thing.
Poking about to find out more about @twinterval. Found twitterers I know from elsewhere on the interwebz.
Want to d/l fring to my phone. All the open WiFi spots have weak signals. Could use Orange gprs but that means Â£. Will wait 'til I get home.
Enjoying - though only half-watching - Wallander on the box. May look at some of the books.
http://twitpic.com/p77v - Organised. Wrapped already and it's still November.
Headline on BBC news was Riots 'kill hundreds in Nigeria. I misread it as Robots kill hundreds... I think the interwebz have warped my mind.
Liking the N96 even more as I get to know its quirks. An example: if you have messages waiting, the menu button pulses when it glows.
http://twitpic.com/p0g0 - Curry tonight, om nom nom.
Publishing info about the police to become illegal. Is this true? If so it's a fucking disgrace. http://is.gd/9VnU
Taking my mail off desktop. One webmail for registering with websites, shops etc., another for real people I actually want to talk to.
Seems there are no trains from London Bridge at the moment. Not sure what's up. Tube is OK.
friendfeed: worth it or just another account racked up somewhere?
3 layers + hat + scarf + heating on and I'm still cold. Bugger this, I'm off to bed. Much warmer there.
http://www.last.fm/bestof/2008 Some interesting stuff, but plenty of meh. And what's with so much Coldplay?
Compiling drudge work for underlings. Poor underlings.
Watching colleagues put up some ratty xmas decorations that must've served at least 10 years. Surprised that the tinsel is not yet bald.
Morning off. House to myself. Just had a cuppa. Homemade soup defrosting for lunch. Lovely. Office xmas party later.
Have managed to get iTunes to play FLAC files, but airport won't join in so it's puter speakers only. :/
Reinstalled flash. Browsers crashing all over the shop. Uninstalled again. Wonder why it's fucking with my puter so badly. :(
Went to M&S for new undies etc; it's 20% off today. Saw massive queue, turned round and ran away. Thank god for shopping online.
Still hungover. Have placed my trust in the healing power of pizza. I hope it doesn't let me down.
Not at the pub yet. That smells of fail if you ask me.
Delay in new CMS means delay relaunching website, so am renewing image licences for the current site. Am on the ball, me.
Wallander again. So much tilt-shift and selective focus. What next? Dragan effect on every channel?
Trying broadband speed test at http://is.gd/aBsK. My results with virgin are 0.1Mbps down 0.4 up; sposed to be 'up to 8meg'. Hmph. Bin 'em.
Turns out my interwebz are being censored: http://is.gd/ayH9. Not happy about that. Been meaning to dump virgin, this adds one more reason.
Still feeling like I'll Never Drink Again after Friday's shindig.
That's not mine btw. Saw it on b3ta.
Ivor the Atat: http://is.gd/aUgn
Testing broadband speed again. Still v slow, but a little better: 2.2mbps down 0.4 up on virgin's up to 8 meg deal.
Apparently yaffle is an dialect name for the green woodpecker.
Photoshop, cloning. Working on a v old b/w pic so it's very forgiving. Just making something quick and dirty anyway.
Feel the need to do something at least vaguely creative tonight. Perhaps knock something up for b3ta - it's been a while.
http://twitpic.com/rh6z - Action shot from office xmas party last week. Not everyone wants to have their photo taken.
Ah TweetDeck... it's really jolly good. Seems to work better on my mac than on my PC at work.
http://twitpic.com/rgke - About to start cooking
Home. Cuppa. Bath the kids in a minute.
Right then, home. Sorting out online training for remote staff can wait until tomorrow.
Another mark in the Against column for fbook - virus fun: http://is.gd/aQ1z. Then again it's hardly unexpected, is it?
2 tasks ready for my freelancers. Costs estimated, schedules made, breifs written; just need to get supporting material and zip them all up.
Back to work. Must resist the call of the internets.
Craving leafy veg, darker green the better. Kale, spinach, savoy cabbage. What do I have for lunch? A manky sarnie. Not nom. Not nom at all.
Right then. To bed, before I get drawn any further into random net surfing/twitter searching/other online nonsense.
Said to the Mrs earlier that if 3rd child is a girl I will need, in the future, a manly retreat. She heard it as 'manual treat'. Fnar, etc.
Bed soon. Early start tomorrow, shall be afk for much of the day. May manage a txt update or 2 when not driving, or check in via twibble.
Todays bband speed test gives 1.1mbps down 0.4 up. Ho hum...
Nerd stuff: consolidating domain names over to a single registrar. Probably http://www.ukreg.com/ unless anyone has other recommendations.
http://twitpic.com/rpt4 Risotto, part rice part pearl barley, with mixed beans, spinach and chives. Smelled so good when the chives went in.
Getting hungry again. Afternoon apple long gone. Probably won't get any more work done this evening. Time to go home and cook risotto.
Poking about twittergroups after @jemimakiss mentioned them. Nothing for publishers yet. Perhaps I should start one for grammarnazis.
Exporting huge amounts of SGML, but not all in one go. Crappy, crappy, crappier, crappiest, crapsome, crapmongerous, encrapulated, crapPOW!!
Sky turning a strange dusty peach out of one window; washed out pearl through another and duck egg blue through a third.
Gah! Twitchy eyelid.
Eating a small orange fruit. Tangerine, clementine, satsuma? Fuck knows. How to tell? It's lovely whatever it is; tart, tender and juicy.
Lunchtime soon. Hungarian Goulash from Eat I think. May also get a muffin. Nom!
Feeling the pain of messy metadata.
Good lord, what *is* this stupid dance they're doing!?
"It's been an incredible journey," says some woman on Strictly. GAHFUCKOFFYOUCOCKINGCLICHÃMONGER!
Mmm, hot chocolate. Just right for a grim, wet, cold evening like this.
Xmas tree up. Is huge! At least twice the size it looked when I bought it. Muppet Xmas Carol on tv soon.
Getting xmas tree later today. Wonder what states the lights will be in once I untangle them.
Order placed. Dim sum heading my way. Nom.
Ordering Chinese food. Or trying to, but the line is engaged.
Budgets squeezed; modest increase in freelance rates I was trying for goes into the bin. Hardly surprising but still a shame.
Is it just me or is it quiet on the internets today?
Moon to appear bigger than usual tonight; is closer due to orbit. http://is.gd/bkob Bet is cloudy or I forget to look. Pics plz flickr ppl?
BBC news site, 7 days quiz, q3: apparently police in Norn Iron are sending ex-cons xmas cards feat. a very grumpy looking snowman. WTF?
Coincidences: street outside the office just now was full of American women, not all of them were together.
V little motivation today. Will prep work to keep assistant editors busy next week, but other than that... meh. Maybe it'll pick up later.
Don't think Milliband came over well in interview with Humphries on the Today show this morning.
Heh. 'The Baby Lab'.
Object permanence and some innate understanding of maths? Blimey. Hardcore. Loving the experiments they devise to discover all this stuff.
What does the z in zomg stand for anyway? Zombie? Or just... yunno... nothing?
ZOMG! "the nose contains erectile tissue... this may also become engorged during arousal, triggering the need to sneeze" http://is.gd/cwIX
Reading stuff in the Graun about pensions. The system's fucked, if the article is accurate. Unsettling prospect, but what's the alternative?
A package of delicious treats heading my way from France has disappeared. What're the odds that a postie somewhere is chowing down?
Coffee and a Krispy Kreme. Nom!
Staring dumbly at tweetstats graphs. Mmmm, nerdy. :) http://tweetstats.com/
New timetable in swing. Mild confusion reigns at London Bridge as they split trains. Or it did, for about 5 mins. All seems sorted now.
How not to crack coconuts (vid) http://is.gd/cktV.
Spent ages on letters. Tried to print on headed paper and the printer fucked up; it looks like dirty 4th-gen photocopies. Bah.
Time for lunch: penne with cauliflower and chili - nom.
40 letters written this morning. 60 to go. Then there's printing, signing, stuffing into envelopes... sheesh. Old-skool communication sucks.
Fancy keeping that X-factor shite off the xmas number one spot? http://is.gd/ciQ7
It's a cold day, so WHY IS THE AIRCON ON!? Is building-wide system, so cannot turn it off. Fail. Chilly, chilly fail. :(
Producing many letters. Much copypasta from PDF into new word doc from template, clean up, save, move on and start over. DULL! DULL! DULL!
Starting the day with some slapstick lulz: Blue Peter presenter puts the star on the Trafalgar Sq xmas tree, but drops it. http://is.gd/chZ7
Haven't picked my camera up in for ever. Needed time away when I got stuck in a rut. Time to come back with some fresh ideas, soon I hope.
Take-away tonight. A rest. Hmm... Chinese or Indian?
Lazy day, v late lunch, lolling about. Lovely. Happy new year all.
Happy new year all. Hope 2009 brings what you'd like it to.
Tired. Hope I wake up a bit before they arrive.
In-laws imminent.
Finished my book of Moomin comic strips by Tove Jansson last night (http://is.gd/eedX). Bit miffed than I don't have more left to read now.
Quite enjoyed Shooting Stars. Funny seeing how everyone has aged. Wonder how I looked when I last watched it. Quite a bit younger I suppose.
Softplay was good. Lunch went well. Relaxing now. This could be our first doom-free day since... er... some time before xmas.
Off to Beckenham later, taking the girls to softplay. Think they need to run about a bit/clamber on things.
That should be woke too early...
Tired this morning. Stayed up too late, work too early, sleep interrupted by crying kids inbetween.
Decided to set up @familywords now - the basics at least. Had an idle moment & in-laws visiting soon, so decided not to hang around.
Have set up first part of project: @offensivewords. Will do family words in a day or two. Then I need to get ppl to contribute their words.
Getting better. Park yesterday, supermarket today. Stamina and appetites improving. Still not 100% though.
Just watched the stupidest episode of Family Guy ever. Really piss poor.
Thinking of starting a project collecting people's made-up words. Family words, friends' slang etc. Need to think of a good name for it.
When it was just Pinter and Kitt I was saying they go in 3s. Now Wisdom's gone too. Wonder whether that's the lot for celebrity xmas deaths.
First pleasant morning in ages. Woke late, cuppa, girls playing nicely, illness just about gone. Will cook a shepherd's pie for lunch soon.
Watching the Young Ones. Nostalgia.
Looking at Drupal and wondering: do I really want to do this?
